subject: Bicycles and Bicycling
lead_paragraph: Denis Menchov of Russia moved closer to his second Vuelta a España title in three years, and Samuel Sánchez of Spain won the next-to-last stage yesterday. Menchov finished second, 12 seconds behind Sánchez. Menchov, who rides for Rabobank, stretched his lead over Carlos Sastre to 3 minutes 31 seconds with an overall time of 78:21.40. Today’s final stage is 64.7 miles from Rivas Vaciamadrid to Madrid.
